intro: Moehringia lateriflora var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender leaf moehringia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like foliage and small, white to pink flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade. Its slender leaves and compact growth habit make it a distinctive and ornamental species in its native environment. It is often found in association with other alpine flora, contributing to the biodiversity of high-elevation ecosystems.
